netInt.visualElements

Class Bezier

  • java.lang.Object
    • netInt.visualElements.Bezier

  • public class Bezier
extends java.lang.Object
    This class draws bezier curves from two nodes. The source node is the origin of the curve and target node is the end. The curve may be drawn in three parts: the first third is the head that goes attached to the source. The last third is the tail attached to the target. Head and tail are drawn on top of the curve body, leaving exposed the middle part.
    Author:
    jsalam

      Constructors

      Bezier()
      A Bezier with source and target at the same origin
      Bezier(processing.core.PVector source, processing.core.PVector target)
      The Beziers are instantiated defining the control points of source and target PVectors and a sagitta corresponding to the lenght of control points.
      Bezier(processing.core.PVector oA, processing.core.PVector cA, processing.core.PVector cB, processing.core.PVector oB)
      This bezier gets source, target and their corresponding control points.

      • Bezier

        public Bezier(processing.core.PVector oA,
              processing.core.PVector cA,
              processing.core.PVector cB,
              processing.core.PVector oB)
        This bezier gets source, target and their corresponding control points. It is used to draw segments of primary beziers returned by the getBezierThird() method.
        Parameters:
        oA - Origin A
        cA - Control point of A
        cB - Control point of B
        oB - Origin B

                                  float thickness)

        Parameters:

        thickness - thickness

      • drawBezier2D

        public void drawBezier2D(processing.core.PApplet app,
                         float thickness)
        Draws just the bezier with the currentColor() and localAlpha values.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet
        thickness - The thickness does not belong to this class but to VEdge, therefore it is received as a parameter. If the thickness is less that 1 it is set to 1.
